conbody.p: Private profile is used to configure notification preferences specific (private) to a Device or User. The private group notification profile is specific (private) to a Group.

Private profiles are created as a result of API calls. Private profiles cannot be created using Notification Management in SM GUI. However, in the SM GUI private notification profiles and private group notification profiles can be viewed as follows:

li.p: For private notification profile, select Notification Management → Notification Preferences → ☰ → Notification Profiles. From the drop-down list at the top, select Private Notification Profile.

For private group notification profile, select Notification Management → Notification Preferences → ☰ → Group Notification Profiles. From the drop-down list at the top, select Private Group Notification Profile.

conbody.p:
The following table lists the parameters of the private profile entity. Private profile parameters
Parameter
Description
Name
The unique identifier of the profile. It is the primary key. It can have a maximum length of 50 characters.
Note: Name must be unique among Notification Profiles, Group Notification Profiles, and Private Profiles.
Description Description of the private profile.
Channels
Defines the preferred subscriber channels. Subscriber can select multiple channels.
Valid values: EMAIL, SMS, SOAP, REST, TCPIP, KAFKA
Default value: SMS
Languages The preferred language for notifications. Multiple languages can be set from a list of languages, which are configured in the application preference Language.
NotificationType
The type of notification such as offers, threshold, etc. The list of notification types can be derived from the system settings. Subscribers can select the type of notifications they want to receive.
Valid values: Usage, Failures, Account Update, Offers, Threshold
Note: 'Usage' and 'Failures' do not support the frequency and notification start time and end time.
Local
If this field is set to true, then the notifications can be sent to the subscribers when they are in their home network.
This field is applicable to all the notification types (Failure, Usage, Threshold, Account Update, Offers).
Roaming
If this field is set to true, then the notifications can be sent to the subscribers when they are roaming (not in their home network).
This field is applicable to all the notification types (Failure, Usage, Threshold, Account Update, Offers).
Frequency
The maximum number of notifications a subscriber wants to receive in a day, month, or year as specified. For example, if this value is set to 10 and Month, then the subscriber does not receive more than 10 notifications in a month.
This field is applicable to the notification types: Threshold, Account Update, Offers.
From
The starting time of day after which the subscriber wants to receive notifications.
The supported time format is hh:mm:ss, for example: 12:30:22.
This field is applicable to the notification types: Threshold, Account Update, Offers.
To
The ending time until which the subscriber wants to receive notifications.
The supported time format is hh:mm:ss, for example: 12:30:55.
This field is applicable to the notification types: Threshold, Account Update, Offers.
EntityID
The identifier value of entities, such as DeviceId, UserId, SubscriberId, etc. For private group profile, the identifier is GroupId.
Maximum number of characters permitted for this field is 50. This ID should match with entityID in the incoming request from the client.
EntityType
The entity type in the incoming request.
Valid values (private notification profile): DEVICE, USER
Valid values (private group notification profile): GROUP
This should match with the entityType in the incoming request from the client.
